put through.translation[0].definitions[0: to connect someone to someone else on the telephone
Could you put me through to Eddie?
put through.translation[0].definitions[1: to pay for someone to study at school, college etc
She worked as a waitress and put herself through school.
put through.translation[0].definitions[2: to make someone do or experience something difficult or unpleasant
The soldiers were put through eight weeks of basic training.
They really put me through it at the interview.
put through.translation[0].definitions[3: to do what is necessary in order to get a plan or suggestion accepted or approved
Production will start up again when these changes have been put through.
put through.translation[1].definitions[0: to do what is necessary in order to get a plan or suggestion accepted or approved
Production will start up again when these changes have been put through.
